comment_body: @liat-grozovik we need additional unit test for such additional checks

Just asked to add internally, this will be done!
@Eran Dahan<mailto:erand@nvidia.com>


From: lguohan <notifications@github.com>
Sent: Monday, January 25, 2021 10:20 AM
To: Azure/sonic-utilities <sonic-utilities@noreply.github.com>
Cc: Liat Grozovik <liatg@nvidia.com>; Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [Azure/sonic-utilities] Prevent configuring IP interface on a port which is a member of VLAN (#1374)


@liat-grozovik<https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fliat-grozovik&data=04%7C01%7Cliatg%40nvidia.com%7C2b1c8cbb5f864a5144e208d8c109fceb%7C43083d15727340c1b7db39efd9ccc17a%7C0%7C0%7C637471595937271634%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=NS8utWUutvUKWMrHFeWOe0ySUtD%2FoXXH%2BKutBVAfxdc%3D&reserved=0> we need additional unit test for such additional checks

-

This pull request **introduces 1 alert** when merging d17fb1eecc8104edbd8a3963c410f66b00cfed3f into 8119ba25b7453d685a475694142e293c2a3a5341 - [view on LGTM.com](https://lgtm.com/projects/g/Azure/sonic-utilities/rev/pr-a5a37e8e27ced03487f635dd1b3366367f36d468)

**new alerts:**

* 1 for Unused import

Dear @qiluo-msft,
I refactored the function according to your suggestion, added fg support and replaced the log level with constants.
In this case it needs to change its color https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/1369#discussion_r560581783 and output stream,
but in general, it might make sense to use the log function with the flag "also_print_to_console = True" and just print the log message to the cli.
Also returned urllib import, it was an mistake when merging with master.

Dear @prsunny,

Could I ask you to ping someone, who can merge this PR, as I have no rights to do that?
@judyjoseph  This was already approved and committed but reverted due to vs-image test failure. Recreated a new PR.
you will have to update config/main.py

> @smaheshm can you please review the change?
> I have simply modified the wrapper from config.main to align with the desired command format on pfcwd.main.
> Looks like on the unit-tests we are calling these function directly from pfcwd.main script and not from the config.main script so the test didn't catch this bug.

That's right. Not sure why pfcwd wasn't added as a module. Can you add a unit test that uses 'config pfcwd' CLI.

> > @smaheshm can you please review the change?
> > I have simply modified the wrapper from config.main to align with the desired command format on pfcwd.main.
> > Looks like on the unit-tests we are calling these function directly from pfcwd.main script and not from the config.main script so the test didn't catch this bug.
> 
> That's right. Not sure why pfcwd wasn't added as a module. Can you add a unit test that uses 'config pfcwd' CLI.

@smaheshm calling the 'config' script to start pfcwd is failing on the unit-test environment, need to further investigate it.
I suggest to merge this PR first to fix this issue and I will handle the 'config' test adaptation on a different PR.
what do you think?

@smaheshm i agree that testing is always good to have. but in this case it is not the scopt. we are missing as a community various of test infra to add tests for bugs fixes.
as this bug is critical as one cannot configure specific pfc wd as before i suggest first to merge the fix and add to the next release backlog the  infra for pfc wd testing on vs.

With the following diff, this can be cherry picked onto 201911.

```
remanava@BN6-0101-0123-15T1:~/try$ zdiff rt.py route_check.py 
1c1
< #!/usr/bin/env python
---
> #!/usr/bin/env python3
80c80
<     t = ipaddress.ip_address(ip.split("/")[0].decode('utf-8'))
---
>     t = ipaddress.ip_address(ip.split("/")[0])
85c85
<     t = ipaddress.ip_address(ip.split("/")[0].decode('utf-8'))
---
>     t = ipaddress.ip_address(ip.split("/")[0])
remanava@BN6-0101-0123-15T1:~/try$ 
```

@renukamanavalan 

1. Can you please update the PR description according to the template?
You may check https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/1345 as a reference.

2. Could you please add more information per function of what it intends to do and in case of inputs/output returns add what to expect?

3. is there any HLD of this route check? if not, can you please add a description of this route check and how it is to be used?
I believe there is a requirement this script intend to meet and it will be much more efficient to document it in the code itself if no HLD can be referenced. As there will be no CLI (if I understand it correct) this will not be documented in the command reference guide.
Please note that many of the PRs under sonic-utilities are failing on the 'default' and it seems to be general issue with the build system.

@renukamanavalan Please create PR for 201911. Cherry-pick has conflcit.

@rlhui
It seems the unit tests has passed, but something went wrong with test report processing. Could anybody help to understand what is wrong?

> retest this please

As I told before, there is some problem with Jenkins. All the tests completely pass in Console output, but I see that all the builds have been failing since December, 29th, so, I think retesting will no make any effect.
BTW, the build issue is being investigated.

Dear @gechiang, @lguohan,

All the checks have passed. Could you continue review process?

@prsunny  Seems like build is failing below error
13:02:56  ERROR: pip's dependency resolver does not currently take into account all the packages that are installed. This behaviour is the source of the following dependency conflicts.

> Does #1328 supersedes this PR?

@prsunny  Yes, I have resolved the merge conflicts. Please review the changes now.
@prsunny @lguohan Please review and merge the PR.
@jleveque Could you kindly review this as all test cases are passing?

@stephenxs can you please confirm all the files on this PR indeed required? there are 83 files changed

> @stephenxs can you please confirm all the files on this PR indeed required? there are 83 files changed

Yes, all of them are required. Most of the are the mock config_dbs for the db_migrator unit test for each version and SKUs.
We will have even more on master because we will need to verify warmreboot cases as well.

Thanks for enhancing the tech support collection. One suggestion I have is next time PRs like this can be split into multiple PRs with each PR having a specific fix or enhancement. This makes it easier to revert a PR when there's an issue, also the PR looks cleaner and easier on the reviewer.

Have you raised or going to raise a PR for tech support unit tests
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/tree/master/tests/show_techsupport

Thanks for making the changes. Looks good. 
My main concern is the unit test for existing test cases. Would like to see the output of pytest. 

Since you added new features, in case you are still working on writing unit tests for the new features, would like to see the output. For example.. the output of "global timeout" case and the "command timeout" case. I'm sure you've tested it, just 'copy/paste' the output.

Regarding "I am adding some tests in sonic-mgmt for the changes" -- have you raised a PR or are working on it.

Adding @qiluo-msft for another pair of eyes.

Rest looks good to me.

Still working on sonic-mgmt test PR. I will add it later.

Note that this PR does not contain sonic-utilities UT because we are extending a command that does not have such a test today. However we will fix this in a follow-up PR.

> Thanks for enhancing the tech support collection. One suggestion I have is next time PRs like this can be split into multiple PRs with each PR having a specific fix or enhancement. This makes it easier to revert a PR when there's an issue, also the PR looks cleaner and easier on the reviewer.

thanks
@lguohan any further comments or we can proceed with the merge?
@lguohan kindly reminder. is your comment addressed and PR can be merged?
